Subject: PingCastle API
Description:
Depuis quelques temps, nous avons une erreur sur lâ€™API de PingCastle 
The remote server returned an error: (405) Method Not Allowed.

Le script que nous utilisons fonctionne depuis plusieurs mois, mais erreur depuis peu.

Script en question :

Param(
    [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
    $AppSecret,
    [Parameter(Mandatory=$true)]
    $UserId
)

$PingCastleServer = "serverping.domain.local"

$Authentication = @{
    apikey   = $AppSecret
    location = $PingCastleServer
}

$Parameters = @{
    Method      = "POST"
    Uri         = "https://$PingCastleServer/api/Agent/Login"
    Body        = ($Authentication | ConvertTo-Json)
    ContentType = "application/json"
}
$Token = Invoke-RestMethod @Parameters
$headers = @{
    Authorization = "$Token"
}

$response = Invoke-RestMethod "https://$PingCastleServer/api/Users/$UserId" -Method 'DELETE' -Headers $headers
$response | ConvertTo-Json
What_We_Know__c:
There is a bug in the API deletion. It seems that when any session is open, even after closing the browser, as the session stays in the DB for some time, and then can't delete the user and any permission granted to Azure AD.
The team is working on a hotfix for it, so you will be notified once the hotfix is out.

Something worth to mention, is that if you use the UI, it works, so you can use the UI while the team works on the solution.
Next_Steps__c: Wait for customer confirmation after explaining it was fixed in the latest release
Solution_Comment__c:
Symptom
Error when trying to delet users with the API

Cause
there was a bug

Resolution
Fixed in latest version of PC Enterprise
